message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM

This paper deals with cross-lingual alignment of texts, which is a problem in natural language processing. The use of topic models and encyclopedic knowledge suggests that this paper is likely to belong to the sub-category of Computational Linguistics (cs.CL). Additionally, the paper involves modeling the ordering of themes in the collection of documents, which is a task that falls under Information Retrieval (cs.IR). The use of HMMs and concept annotations suggests that this paper may also belong to the sub-categories of Machine Learning (cs.LG) and Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI). Finally, the evaluation of the method on English and French data suggests that this paper may also belong to the sub-category of Multimedia (cs.MM), which deals with the processing of multimedia data in different languages.
